elements.title: Roosevelt Island Tramway (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that New York City's Roosevelt Island Tramway (pictured) was placed next to a bridge to prevent collisions with planes?

elements.title: The Torture Camp on Paradise Street (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Stanislav Aseyev, the author of The Torture Camp on Paradise Street, was placed in the Izolyatsia torture camp for writing "Donetsk People's Republic" in quotation marks in a social media post?

elements.title: Boquila trifoliolata (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Boquila trifoliolata is the only known plant capable of simultaneously mimicking multiple species?

elements.title: Jorge Barón (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jorge Barón, a member of King County Council, was an assistant director on The Mask of Zorro?

elements.title: Westworld (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the play-by-mail game Westworld was run from prison?

elements.title: a version of Prokofiev's Peter and the Wolf (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that David Bowie narrated a version of Prokofiev's Peter and the Wolf in 1978 as a gift for his seven-year-old son Duncan?

elements.title: The Connor Brothers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that The Connor Brothers were believed to be two 20-something artists from Brooklyn, but are actually two British art dealers from London?

elements.title: Harmony of the Gospels (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Augustine of Hippo's Harmony of the Gospels is technically not a Gospel harmony?
